title: Electron Configuration Basics
description: Learn how electrons are arranged in atoms and the rules governing electron configuration
subject: Chemistry

text.introduction: Electrons in atoms occupy specific energy levels and orbitals according to established rules. Understanding electron configuration is essential for predicting chemical behavior, bonding patterns, and properties of elements.

sections.title: Energy Levels and Sublevels
sections.content: Electrons occupy energy levels (n = 1, 2, 3, ...) around the nucleus. Each energy level contains sublevels: s, p, d, and f. The s sublevel holds 2 electrons, p holds 6, d holds 10, and f holds 14. The number of sublevels increases with energy level number.

sections.title: Aufbau Principle
sections.content: The Aufbau principle states that electrons fill orbitals in order of increasing energy. The typical filling order is: 1s, 2s, 2p, 3s, 3p, 4s, 3d, 4p, 5s, 4d, 5p, 6s, 4f, 5d, 6p, 7s, 5f, 6d, 7p. This can be remembered using the diagonal rule or electron configuration charts.

sections.title: Pauli Exclusion Principle
sections.content: Wolfgang Pauli's exclusion principle states that no two electrons in an atom can have the same set of four quantum numbers. This means each orbital can hold a maximum of two electrons, and they must have opposite spins (paired electrons).

sections.title: Hund's Rule
sections.content: Friedrich Hund's rule states that electrons occupy orbitals of equal energy singly before pairing up. This minimizes electron-electron repulsion and maximizes stability. For example, in the p sublevel, electrons fill px, py, and pz orbitals singly before pairing.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of electrons that can occupy a d sublevel?
questions.explanation: The d sublevel contains 5 orbitals, and each orbital can hold a maximum of 2 electrons, giving a total of 10 electrons.

questions.question: According to Hund's rule, how do electrons fill orbitals of equal energy?
options: Fill from highest to lowest energy
questions.explanation: Hund's rule states that electrons occupy orbitals of equal energy singly before pairing up to minimize repulsion.

exercises.title: Electron Configuration Practice
exercises.instructions: Write the electron configurations for the first 20 elements using both full notation and noble gas notation.
exercises.hint: Use the Aufbau principle and remember to follow Hund's rule for half-filled and completely filled sublevels.
